episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of historical and cultural topics, including the origins of Paris's first public transport system, the surprising Chinese origins of the Aladdin story, the medieval origins of merry-go-rounds, and the peculiar naming of earwigs in Japan.

facts.fact: Paris's first public transport system failed because wealthy passengers bought all the seats for themselves and then persuaded the government to ban poor people.
Merry-go-rounds were invented in medieval times for knights to ride on.
In some parts of Japan, earwigs are known as Chinpo Kiri, literally penis cutters.
